docs.snippet: Hundreds of records detailing sex-crime investigations involving U.S. military personnel stationed in Japan show most offenders were not incarcerated, suspects received light punishments after being accused of serious violations, and victims incre...
docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of records detailing sex-crime investigations involving U.S. military personnel stationed in Japan show most offenders were not incarcerated, suspects received light punishments after being accused of serious violations, and victims increasingly were wary of cooperating with investigators.

headline.main: AP Findings on US Military Sex Crimes in Japan
headline.print_headline: AP Findings on US Military Sex Crimes in Japan

docs.snippet: Boston plans to launch a gun buyback program in a bid to reduce shootings following the death last week of a 9-year-old boy who was shot by his 14-year-old brother in an apparent accident, Mayor Marty Walsh said....
docs.lead_paragraph: Boston plans to launch a gun buyback program in a bid to reduce shootings following the death last week of a 9-year-old boy who was shot by his 14-year-old brother in an apparent accident, Mayor Marty Walsh said.

headline.main: Boston Plans Gun Buybacks After Shooting Death of 9-Year-Old
headline.print_headline: Boston Plans Gun Buybacks After Shooting Death of 9-Year-Old

docs.snippet: Swiss voters on Sunday narrowly backed proposals to reintroduce immigration quotas with the European Union, Swiss television reported - a result that calls into question bilateral accords with the EU and could irk multinational companies....
docs.lead_paragraph: Swiss voters on Sunday narrowly backed proposals to reintroduce immigration quotas with the European Union, Swiss television reported - a result that calls into question bilateral accords with the EU and could irk multinational companies.

headline.main: Swiss Vote to Set Limits on Immigration From EU
headline.print_headline: Swiss Vote to Set Limits on Immigration From EU

docs.snippet: Since Nigeria’s president signed a law criminalizing homosexuality, arrests of gay people have multiplied and demands for a crackdown have flourished....
docs.lead_paragraph: Since Nigeria’s president signed a law criminalizing homosexuality, arrests of gay people have multiplied and demands for a crackdown have flourished.
docs.abstract: Arrests of gay people in Nigeria have multiplied since Pres Goodluck Jonathan signed a harsh law criminalizing homosexuality throughout the country; advocates have been forced to go underground, some people fearful of the law have sought asylum overseas and news media demands for a crackdown have flourished.

headline.main: Nigeria Tries to ‘Sanitize’ Itself of Gays
headline.print_headline: Wielding Whip and a Hard New Law, Nigeria Tries to ‘Sanitize’ Itself of Gays

docs.snippet: Inspired by the return of “The Walking Dead,” a proposal for adapting five graphic novels or comic book series for prime time....
docs.lead_paragraph: Inspired by the return of “The Walking Dead,” a proposal for adapting five graphic novels or comic book series for prime time.
docs.abstract: Television versions of graphic novels Mind MGMT, Fatale, American Vampire, Hawkeye and Manhattan Projects are described as potential good additions to host of current shows, like AMC's The Walking Dead, that are based on comic books.

headline.seo: Proposing TV Adaptations of Comic Books
headline.main: Graphic Novels to Graphic Prime Time
headline.print_headline: Graphic Novels to Graphic Prime Time

docs.snippet: Ms. Heyman found in Israel’s system of youth villages a model for assisting the young survivors of the Rwandan genocide....
docs.lead_paragraph: Ms. Heyman found in Israel’s system of youth villages a model for assisting the young survivors of the Rwandan genocide.
docs.abstract: Anne Heyman, South African-born lawyer who had given up her legal career in New York to devote herself to philanthropy in Rwanda, dies at age 52.

headline.main: Anne Heyman, Who Rescued Rwandan Orphans, Dies at 52

docs.snippet: I naïvely thought the accusation would be dismissed....
docs.lead_paragraph: I naïvely thought the accusation would be dismissed.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by filmmaker Woody Allen, responding to his daughter Dylan Farrow's accusation that he molested her when she was a child, disputes her account.
